ETYMOLOGY: From Old English ælmihtig (composed of eal 'all' + mihtig 'mighty'), meaning 'having all power, omnipotent'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adjective: A word or phrase naming an attribute, added to or grammatically related to a noun to modify or describe it. Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Having unlimited power; omnipotent. Often used as a title for God.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 拥有无限权力的；全能的。常作上帝的称谓。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The preacher spoke of the almighty power of God.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 传教士谈到了上帝的无限神力。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adjective: A word or phrase naming an attribute, added to or grammatically related to a noun to modify or describe it.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (informal, often British) Used as an intensifier to express extreme size, extent, or degree.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: (非正式，常用于英式英语) 用作强调词，表示极大的尺寸、程度或数量。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She gave an almighty push and the door finally opened.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她用力猛推了一下，门终于开了。

REGISTER: Varies depending on context: formal (religious) or informal (intensifier).
